sen.j: 衣蛸（ころもだこ）は、京都府与謝郡に伝わる海の妖怪。
sen.e: Koromodako' refers to a yokai (apparitions, spirits, spooks or monsters) in the sea handed down in Yosa Province, Kyoto Prefecture.
Koromodako' refers to a yokai (monster) in the sea handed down in Yosa County, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: apparitions, spirits, spooks or monsters を monster に修正しました。Province を County に修正しました。
sen.e: Koromodako' refers to a yokai (monster) in the sea handed down in Yosa County, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: その名前が示すようにタコの妖怪。
sen.e: As the name suggests, it is a yokai of an octopus.
As the name suggests, it is an octopus monster.
sen.cmt: a yokai of an octopus を an octopus monster に修正しました。
sen.e: As the name suggests, it is an octopus monster.

sen.j: 外観は普通のタコと変わりない。
sen.e: Its appearance is the same as the ordinary octopus,
Its appearance is the same as the ordinary octopus.
sen.cmt: 文末のカンマをピリオドに修正しました。
sen.e: Its appearance is the same as the ordinary octopus.

sen.j: しかし、漁師がこれを捕らえようとして船を近づけると、体を六畳ほどにも広げて船を丸ごと包み込んでしまう。
sen.e: However, when fishermen move their ship closer to capture it, it spreads the body as big as six tatami mats and tries to wrap the entire ship.
However, when fishermen move their ship closer to capture it, it spreads the body as big as six tatami mats and tries to wrap the entire ship.
However, when fishermen move their ship closer to capture it, it spreads the body as big as six tatami mats and tries to wrap the entire ship.

sen.j: 普段は貝殻の中に入って、海の上を漂っているともいう。
sen.e: It is said that it usually stays inside of a shell and drifts in the sea.
It is said that it usually stays inside of a shell and drifts in the sea.
It is said that it usually stays inside of a shell and drifts in the sea.

sen.j: ちなみに実在のタコであり外洋で遊泳生活するムラサキダコも、足と足の間に衣のような薄膜を持つことから、漁師にはコロモダコの俗名で呼ばれている。
sen.e: In addition, the actual octopus, 'murasakidako' (Tremoctopodidae), drifting in the ocean is also called 'koromodako' by fishermen, because it has a thin membrane like clothes between its legs.
In addition, the blanket octopus which is actually drifting in the ocean is commonly called "koromodako" by fishermen, because it has a thin membrane like a cloth between its legs.
In addition, the blanket octopus which is a real creature drifting in the ocean is commonly called "koromodako" by fishermen, because it has a thin membrane like a cloth between its legs.

sen.j: またムラサキダコに縁の近いカイダコ類は、同様に外洋で遊泳生活をし、雌は腕から貝殻を分泌してその中に包まっており、この貝殻の中で卵を保育する。
sen.e: Moreover, 'kaidako 'which belongs to Argonautida, similar to Tremoctopodidae, is also drifting in the ocean and female kaidako secretes shells from its arms and wraps itself in the shell and incubates eggs in it.

Moreover, species of paper nautilus which is similar to the blanket octopus are also drifting in the ocean, and the female of which secretes shells from its arms and wraps itself in the shell and incubates eggs in it.

Moreover, species of paper nautilus which is similar to the blanket octopus are also drifting in the ocean, and the female of which secretes shells from its arms and wraps itself in the shell and incubates eggs in it.
